title: Sorting Materials into Groups
description: Learn about different properties of materials and how to classify them based on their characteristics.

questions.question: Which of these is a property of metals?
questions.explanation: Metals are good conductors of heat and electricity, while they are not brittle, transparent, or soft.

questions.question: What property makes a material float on water?
questions.explanation: Materials with low density float on water because they are lighter than water.

questions.question: Which of these is a transparent material?
questions.explanation: Glass is transparent as it allows light to pass through it, while wood, metal, and most plastics are opaque.

questions.question: What property makes a material magnetic?
questions.explanation: Materials containing iron or other magnetic elements can be attracted by magnets.

questions.question: Which of these is a property of non-metals?
questions.explanation: Non-metals are generally brittle, meaning they break easily when hit, unlike metals which are malleable and ductile.

questions.question: What property makes a material soluble in water?
questions.explanation: Soluble materials can dissolve in water, forming a solution.

questions.question: Which of these is a property of plastics?
questions.explanation: Plastics are water-resistant, which is why they are used to make containers and waterproof materials.

questions.question: What property makes a material a good insulator?
questions.explanation: Good insulators have low conductivity, meaning they don't allow heat or electricity to pass through easily.

questions.question: Which of these is a property of rubber?
questions.explanation: Rubber is elastic, meaning it can stretch and return to its original shape.

questions.question: What property makes a material a good conductor of electricity?
questions.explanation: Good conductors of electricity have free electrons that can move easily, allowing electric current to flow.
